program but the one owned by the payer.

errors.name: InvalidFulfillMessage
errors.msg: Signature does not match the seed

types.name: Callback
docs: A client callback.
There are function added for convenience:
-   [`Callback::from_instruction_data`]
-   [`Callback::with_remaining_account`]
-   [`Callback::with_remaining_accounts`]

fields.name: remaining_accounts
docs: Additional accounts to add to the callback CPI call.
-   the first one will always be the [`Client`] PDA (signer)
-   the second one will always be the client state PDA of the client program (writable)
-   the third one will always be the [`super::network_state::NetworkState`] PDA
-   the fourth one will always be the corresponding [`super::request::RequestAccount`] PDA
-   subsequent accounts will be remaining accounts given here.

fields.name: data
docs: Borsh-serialized instruction data.

types.name: CallbackAlt
docs: A client callback with [Address Lookup Tables][lookup-tables] support.
This callback type could be handy if callback accounts does not fit into
the Solana transaction.
There are functions added for convenience:
-   [`CallbackAlt::from_instruction_data`]
-   [`CallbackAlt::compile_accounts`]
[lookup-tables]: https://solana.com/ru/developers/guides/advanced/lookup-tables

fields.name: accounts_hash
docs: This hash is used to validate lookup accounts.
Asserts the order and values of public keys in the [`CallbackAlt::remaining_accounts`].

fields.name: remaining_accounts
docs: Additional accounts to add to the callback CPI call.
-   the first one will always be the [`Client`] PDA (signer)
-   the second one will always be the client state PDA of the client program (writable)
-   the third one will always be the [`super::network_state::NetworkState`] PDA
-   the fourth one will always be the corresponding [`super::request::RequestAccount`] PDA
-   subsequent accounts will be remaining accounts given here —
note that writable remaining accounts must be authorized (see [`RemainingAccount::seeds`]).

fields.name: data
docs: Borsh-serialized instruction data.

types.name: CallbackUpdated
docs: Event that signals that a callback was updated.

fields.name: defined
docs: `true` if new callback is `Some(_)`.

types.name: CalledBack
docs: Event that signals that a callback was called.

types.name: Client
docs: This PDA represents a state of a registered client.

fields.name: owner
docs: The owner is able to manage the client:
-   withdraw client funds
-   transfer ownership

fields.name: program
docs: An address of a registered program.

fields.name: state
docs: An arbitrary PDA that belongs to the client program.
This is the request authority.

fields.name: num_requests
docs: Number of requests made by the client.

fields.name: callback
docs: An optional client-level callback.
If it is `None`, then no callback will be called upon request fulfill, but you can
override this using the request-level callback (see [`RequestParams::callback`]).
You can update this value using the [`SetCallback`] instruction.
[`RequestParams::callback`]: crate::RequestParams::callback
[`SetCallback`]: crate::SetCallback

types.name: ConfigureParams
docs: [`Configure`] instruction parameters.

fields.name: new_config
docs: New configuration.

fields.name: request_fee
docs: Per-request fee in lamports.

types.name: LookupAccount
docs: Points to an account in a lookup table.

fields.name: table_index
docs: An index of a particular lookup table in the list of lookup tables given
to the [`crate::RequestAlt`] instruction.

fields.name: address_index
docs: An index of a particular address in the specified lookup table.

fields.name: seeds
docs: This seeds are used to set account as writable.
-   `None` here means a read-only account
-   empty vector here means arbitrary writable account — this requires
the account to be given as writable to the corresponding "request"
or "register" instruction.
-   empty/non-empty vector here means client program PDA — account
becomes writable if derived address matches

types.name: NetworkConfiguration
docs: Oracle configuration

fields.name: authority
docs: An authority.

fields.name: treasury
docs: Treasury account address.

fields.name: request_fee
docs: Per-request fee paid by a client.

fields.name: callback_deadline
docs: Callback deadline measured in slots (1 slot is approximately 400ms).
If callback keeps failing util this deadline reached, then the request
will be fulfilled without calling the callback.
Note that well-written callback should never fail, so this should never
apply to your client.

fields.name: fulfill_authorities
docs: This parties are authorized to fulfill requests.

types.name: NetworkState
docs: This PDA holds oracle state and configuration.

fields.name: bump
docs: Account bump.

fields.name: config
docs: Active configuration.

fields.name: num_requests
docs: Total number of received requests.

fields.name: num_registered
docs: Total number of registered clients.

fields.name: num_terminated
docs: Total number of terminated clients.

types.name: Pending
docs: Pending randomness request.

fields.name: responses
docs: Responses collected so far.

fields.name: callback
docs: Callback (if any).

fields.name: callback_override
docs: If `true` then [`Pending::callback`] is a request-level callback.

types.name: PendingAlt
docs: Pending randomness request.

fields.name: responses
docs: Responses collected so far.

fields.name: callback
docs: Callback (if any).

fields.name: lookup_tables
docs: Lookup Tables given to the callback.

types.name: RegisterParams
docs: [`Register`] instruction parameters.

fields.name: state_seeds
docs: Seeds used to generate the [`Register::state`] PDA.
Note that the last seed must be the PDA bump (see [`Pubkey::create_program_address`]).

fields.name: callback
docs: An optional client-level callback (see [`Client::callback`]).

types.name: Registered
docs: Event that signals that new client was registered.

types.name: RemainingAccount
docs: A callback account definition.

fields.name: pubkey
docs: Account address.

fields.name: seeds
docs: This seeds are used to set account as writable.
-   `None` here means a read-only account
-   empty vector here means arbitrary writable account — this requires
the account to be given as writable to the corresponding "request"
or "register" instruction.
-   empty/non-empty vector here means client program PDA — account
becomes writable if derived address matches

section in the main crate docs).

Fill with caution.

types.name: WithdrawParams
docs: [`Withdraw`] instruction parameters.

fields.name: amount
docs: An amount to withdraw (in lamports).
Note that you can't withdraw past the client PDA rent.

types.name: orao_vrf_cb::events::fulfilled::Fulfilled
docs: Event that signals a request was fulfilled.

types.name: orao_vrf_cb::state::request::Fulfilled
docs: Fulfilled request representation.

fields.name: randomness
docs: Generated randomness.
It is validated within the fulfill instruction. Please look into the account history logs
and VRF events to observe the individual components.

fields.name: responses
docs: Individual responses constituting the randomness.
This going to be `Some` within the callback invocation, and `None` afterwards.
